droid_comment:
[P2] Fix reply author color regression

This changes `.topic-meta-data h5 a` from `scale-color($primary, $lightness: 30%)` to `...$lightness: 70%`, which will noticeably reduce contrast in light themes and doesn't match the likely intent of only adjusting for dark themes.

validation.impact: In light themes, the reply author link color will be significantly lighter (70% vs 30% lightness), reducing contrast and readability. The intent of the PR was to fix dark theme colors, but this change also affects light theme by inverting the lightness value.
validation.reasoning: Verified by examining the diff: original was `color: scale-color($primary, $lightness: 30%)`, now changed to `dark-light-choose(scale-color($primary, $lightness: 70%), scale-color($secondary, $lightness: 30%))`. The light theme value went from 30% to 70% - a dramatic inversion that makes text much lighter and harder to read.
validation.code_evidence: git diff shows line 291: original `color: scale-color($primary, $lightness: 30%)` changed to `color: dark-light-choose(scale-color($primary, $lightness: 70%), scale-color($secondary, $lightness: 30%))`

droid_comment:
[P2] Keep mobile modal hint lightness consistent with desktop

Desktop keeps `.custom-message-length` at `$lightness: 70%` for `$primary`, but mobile now uses `$lightness: 30%` for `$primary`, making the hint much darker than intended in light themes.

validation.impact: Mobile .custom-message-length hint text will be much darker than desktop in light themes (30% vs 70% lightness), creating an inconsistent experience across platforms.
validation.reasoning: Original code was `color: scale-color($primary, $lightness: 70%)`. New code uses `dark-light-choose(scale-color($primary, $lightness: 30%), scale-color($secondary, $lightness: 70%))`. The light theme value dropped from 70% to 30%, making text significantly darker. Desktop likely keeps 70% for consistency, but mobile now diverges.
validation.code_evidence: git show origin/theme-color-scheme-pre:app/assets/stylesheets/mobile/modal.scss shows original value was 70%. Current PR code shows 30% for light theme.
